item.title: A few minutes with: ACRL Academic/Research Librarian of the Year David Lewis
item.description: Lewis' work has helped maintain University Library's status as one of the best in higher education.

item.title: New Ostrom Workshop program focuses on institutions and organizations
item.description: A new research program at the Ostrom Workshop is up and running, and its first gathering of researchers will take place this month.

item.title: Head of Mexico Business Forum to present O'Meara International Lecture at Indiana University
item.description: He will speak on "Toward a Prosperous North American Partnership: Issues and Challenges" on the IU Bloomington campus.

item.title: Jagathon breaks $500,000 for first time in event history
item.description: Jagathon, IUPUI's dance marathon, raised a record $501,371.24, benefiting pediatric cancer research at Riley Hospital for Children.

item.title: From the Desk: IU Bloomington provost details new programs in recent State of the Campus address
item.description: In her annual speech, Lauren Robel discussed the recent launch of both the Center for Rural Engagement and IU Corps.

item.title: Salman Rushdie to receive honorary degree from Indiana University
item.description: The critically acclaimed author will also deliver a lecture and meet with students as part of the semesterlong "India Remixed" festival.

item.title: New imaging technique by IU researchers could improve the diagnosis, treatment of glaucoma
item.description: IU researcher Donald Miller and his associates have created a noninvasive method to visualize and count cells at the back of the eye.

item.title: Two campus leaders focus on service, engagement in new roles
item.description: Meet the leaders of two new initiatives at IU Bloomington focused on strengthening the university's community engagement.

item.title: Around IU Bloomington
item.description: Read about IU athletes reading at local schools, the Center for Rural Engagement launch, a funk music pioneer's visit to campus and more.

item.title: IU athletes read to local students on Dr. Seuss Day
item.description: IU men's soccer players recently spent time at Arlington Elementary School reading to students for Dr. Seuss Day.

item.title: IU Bloomington Center for Rural Engagement receives $10 million grant from Lilly Endowment Inc.
item.description: IU Bloomington is strengthening partnerships in surrounding regions with the launch of the Center for Rural Engagement.

item.title: IU First Thursdays celebrates Holi in honor of 'India Remixed'
item.description: The IU Arts and Humanities Council recognized Holi, a Hindu festival celebrating spring, at its inaugural First Thursdays Festival of 2018.

item.title: IU Bloomington assistant professors to receive Outstanding Junior Faculty Award
item.description: Five assistant professors will receive the award that identifies promising tenure-track faculty and helps further develop their activities.

item.title: Tamara Davis named dean of the IU School of Social Work at IUPUI
item.description: Davis previously served as associate dean for academic affairs at the Ohio State University College of Social Work.

item.title: IU digital systems class helping Hoosier National Forest measure light pollution
item.description: The class is constructing a series of monitors that will be placed throughout the forest.

item.title: IU School of Dentistry dedicates state-of-the-art Fritts Clinical Care Center
item.description: The new IU School of Dentistry clinic is a part of plan to ensure Indiana's only dental school is among the best in the world.

item.title: WFIU program 'A Moment of Science' celebrates 30th anniversary
item.description: The popular science program and longtime hosts Don Glass and Yael Ksander commemorate the show's three decades on air.

item.title: Jagathon takes its dance show on the road to benefit Riley Hospital for Children
item.description: With its high school mentorship program and partnership with the Office of Admissions, Jagathon is teaching everyone a few new steps.

item.title: IU Bloomington provost to present State of the Campus address
item.description: The State of the Campus address will include updates on the Bicentennial Strategic Plan and new and expanding programs on campus.

item.title: Around IUPUI
item.description: Learn about faculty being honored for their service, the Top 100 students, Herron's Wearable Art Show, the sports speaker series and more.

item.title: Stanford professor to give two lectures to continue Diversity Speaker Series
item.description: Londa Schiebinger's expertise in science, history and gender issues will be showcased in two lectures March 6.

item.title: New Fitness Center opens today in Campus Center
item.description: The long-awaited facility located below Barnes and Noble offers 10,000 square feet of exercise equipment, yoga sessions and spinning classes.

item.title: IUPUC group showcases the ukulele, campus community-building
item.description: The Ukulele Players have been making beautiful music together in an informal gathering every other week since January.

item.title: IUPUI honors three with Hine Medal
item.description: The award recognizes alumni for their contributions in support of the campus and its alumni programs.

item.title: The IUPUI Center for Research and Learning recognizes outstanding students and a faculty mentor
item.description: Get the rundown on the award winners and their research from this year's Center for Research and Learning awards luncheon.

item.title: Polis Center-assisted study shows disaster planning results in sixfold savings
item.description: The National Institute of Building Sciences' Natural Hazard Mitigation Saves: 2017 Interim Report showed $6 saved for every $1 spent.

item.title: Star Trak: March 2018
item.description: Venus and Mercury will appear so close that they will be in the same binocular field of view in early March. Venus will be much brighter.

item.title: Around IU
item.description: Learn about the continuation of a shuttle between two campuses, an emergency app and updates to IU's digital phonebook.

item.title: From the Desk: IU superintendent of public safety discusses engagement, community-oriented policing
item.description: Regularly enhancing training for IUPD officers means they can continue to provide the services IU's campuses expect.

item.title: Pride of Indiana: Thank-you messages to and from IU employees
item.description: Check out thank-you messages from IU employees to IU employees.

item.title: Part 4: IU experts share tips on the 8 dimensions of wellness
item.description: Part 4 in a series on the importance of holistic wellness features tips from IU experts for nurturing spiritual and intellectual health.

item.title: IU Human Resources launches job framework redesign project
item.description: The university is redesigning the classification structure for appointed staff, creating a new job framework.

item.title: IU's Center for Underwater Science expanding its partnership with NOAA
item.description: The agreement aims to enhance the entities' collaboration on underwater and maritime archaeology, heritage management and public outreach.

item.title: Teacher at Marjory Stoneman Douglas High School: Teaching 'more important now than ever'
item.description: After surviving a school shooting, IU alum Katherine Posada said the experience reaffirmed her belief in the importance of her profession.

item.title: Honors College feasts on leadership in Emerging Leaders program
item.description: IUPUI Honors College students dive deeper into leadership by understanding their own skills and how to be more attractive to employers.

item.title: B-Start program to host Demo Day, award prizes to entrepreneurs on March 6
item.description: The three top-scoring presentations at B-Start's Demo Day will earn $4,500 each for Bloomington-area entrepreneurial teams.

item.title: IU research suggests failed osteoarthritis drug could get new life as opioid-addiction treatment
item.description: An IU study suggests a compound proven safe for use in people could help reduce pain and prevent symptoms that can lead to opioid addiction.

item.title: Around IU Bloomington
item.description: Emerging Areas of Research awards, details on the State of the Campus address, sustainability grants and more.

item.title: African American Arts Institute ensembles perform in community
item.description: See photos from performances put on by dance and music groups at locations throughout Bloomington in honor of Black History Month.

item.title: IU law fellow showcases culinary skills on 'MasterChef Latino'
item.description: IU law fellow and alumnus Mario Arango recently traveled to Miami to compete on the first season of the Telemundo show.

item.title: IUPUI to host annual JagStart competition Friday, March 2
item.description: Students will have three minutes to pitch their ideas for new products or ventures, both commercial and nonprofit, and then face questions.

item.title: IU officials, Indiana FSSA secretary to address opioid management at inaugural event in D.C.
item.description: IU School of Medicine professor Jennifer Walthall will offer keynote remarks at the event.

item.title: IU alum and 'Cinderella' performer returns to campus at IU Auditorium
item.description: IU alum Kaitlyn Mayse returns to campus this week to perform in the national tour of Rodgers + Hammerstein’s ‘Cinderella’ at IU Auditorium.

item.title: IU Distinguished Faculty Research Lecture focuses on warming of Arctic climate
item.description: Jeffrey White will talk about his research and findings from his work on the Arctic tundra in the Distinguished Faculty Research Lecture.

item.title: Glenn A. Black Laboratory of Archaeology salvaging endangered data
item.description: IU's Glenn A. Black Laboratory of Archaeology is salvaging research from obsolete formats in its collection to digitize for accessibility.

item.title: IU creates $15 million Philanthropic Venture Fund to develop innovations, businesses
item.description: The IU Philanthropic Venture Fund has been created to develop inventions and companies resulting from IU research.

item.title: Kristi Palmer appointed interim dean of IUPUI University Library
item.description: The associate librarian and associate dean for digital scholarship replaces David Lewis, who will retire effective May 18.

item.title: Indiana University named top producer for Fulbright U.S. Student and Fulbright Scholars programs
item.description: IU is one of 16 U.S. institutions to be a named a top producer for both the Fulbright U.S. Student Program and Fulbright Scholars Program.

item.title: Beetroot juice supplements may help improve quality of life for certain heart failure patients
item.description: An IUPUI study shows beetroot juice may enhance exercise capacity in certain heart failure patients, a key factor in quality of life.

item.title: Indiana University staff, faculty and alumni again claim big presence in IBJ 'Forty Under 40' list
item.description: Twenty-two of the 40 are related to IU as faculty, staff, alumni or, in one case, a current student.
